newsitem.title: FINLAND: RAISIO GAINS SHARPLY FOR THIRD SESSION.
newsitem.headline: RAISIO GAINS SHARPLY FOR THIRD SESSION.

text.p: Shares in Finnish food and chemicals group Raision Tehtaat rose sharply on Thursday for a third straight session, as investor enthusiasm continued over its U.S. partnership with J&J's McNeil, brokers said.
At 1100/0800 GMT Raisio traded at 627.00 markka, up 62.00 markka or almost 11 percent, in lively 37 million markka trade.
"There doesn't seem to be any ceiling yet, even though a technical recoil will have to come some time," one broker said.
On Tuesday, Raisio unveiled a partnership with Johnson & Johnson company McNeil Consumer Products to market and develop its Benecol cholesterol-cutting agent in North America.
